Posts.Content: Hi, morning. I am on first cycle of chemo with no energy at present. Am day 9. Have members found that the symptoms improve during cycle? Would appreciate any comments. Operahappy
Posts.Title: Chemo symptoms

Posts.Content: Thank you Dreamtheir, will have a look on google. Thanks for taking the time to give me so much information. Nice to know things will get back to normal at some point.  Operahappy
Posts.Title: Loss of sensitivity in feet and finger tips.

Posts.Content: Hi, after 4 rounds of chemo I have lost sensitivity in my finger tips and my feet feel very 'club' like ..... Does anyone know if this will improve with tome? I have finished my chemo and start radiotherapy on Monday 8th Feb. Any info gratefully received. Operahappy
Posts.Title: Loss of sensitivity in feet and finger tips.

Posts.Content: Thank you Dreamtheif that is very helpful. I will have a read. I guess you don't sleep much either? Thanks for help. Operahappy.
Posts.Title: Loss of sensitivity in feet and finger tips.

Posts.Content: Hi Kacang, thanks for the information and taking the time to reply. It is not too bad - hopefully it will improve in time. Operahappy
Posts.Title: Loss of sensitivity in feet and finger tips.

Posts.Content: Hi Bluesy, thanks for replying. I don't mind waiting months but the thought that feet and fingers will get back to normal is great. Thank you so much. Don't suppose you know how to enlarge text on the iPad do you- mine is minuscule.  Thank you again. Operahappy.
Posts.Title: Loss of sensitivity in feet and finger tips.
